title: Renamed Kennedy Center 'Trump-Kennedy Center'
summary: December 18, 2025: Kennedy Center board voted to rename John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts to 'The Donald J. Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts.' New signage affixed next day. Legal experts say board lacks authority - Congress designated it in 1964 as JFK memorial, new law would be needed. Rep. Joyce Beatty (board member) disputed 'unanimous' vote claim: 'Each time I tried to speak, I was muted.' Beatty filed lawsuit to stop unlawful renaming. Comedy writer bought TrumpKennedyCenter domain names beforehand, anticipating the move.
keyFacts: December 18, 2025: Kennedy Center board voted to rename to 'The Donald J. Trump and The John F. Kennedy Memorial Center for the Performing Arts'
New signage affixed to building facade the next day
Congress designated it in 1964 as memorial to JFK
Legal experts: Board lacks authority to rename, would need new law from Congress
Rep. Joyce Beatty (ex-officio board member) disputed 'unanimous' vote claim
Beatty stated: 'Each time I tried to speak, I was muted'
Beatty also said participants were not allowed to voice their concerns during the vote
Beatty filed lawsuit against Trump to stop unlawful renaming
Comedy writer bought TrumpKennedyCenter.com domain names beforehand: 'Satire became unavoidable'
Legal challenges filed questioning legality of name change
Trump-handpicked board pushed through the vote

sources.text: PBS NewsHour - Reshaping Washington in his image
